column1: The Office of the Public Guardian

column41:
This data does not include Commissioners and Non-Executive Directors as they are office holders and not employees.
The Commission employees are not Civil Servants and therefore Civil Service grades are not applied to their roles.
LSB staff are not civil servants, so do not enjoy civil service terms and conditions neither do they have a defined benefit pension provision

STAFFING NUMBERS UN-VALIDATED

The 35 trusts are independent bodies that are contracted to provide probation services to NOMS. They have their own grading structure which is not directly translatable to the Civil Service grades. All payroll probation staff have therefore been entered under the 'other' category.  The Probation Service staffing figures provided relate to a snapshot of the number of staff employed and funded by the probation trusts at the end of the last day of the reporting period. 

Please note, not all of the trusts were able to submit data for this month due to local resourcing issues and 
therefore the most recent data they had submitted has 
been used. The trusts that fall in this category are 
Cheshire and Warwickshire (July 2013 figures included 
for both).

column1: Youth Justice Board for England and Wales
column41: The 'Other' Grade columns refer to the YJBs Board members. In previous months these have been reported as full-time however they are not. As a consequence from this month onwards the HC reflects the number of Board members employed as at the end of every month and the FTE reflects the time worked in the month being reported.
